review_headline: It's Neptune and Friends as Idols...
review_body: It's basically a light novel with music videos thrown in every once and a while. It's a pretty bland experience for a Neptunia game, but there's nothing to be offended about. If you want to spend 3 hours with your favorite Neptunia character, it's a nice time waster. If you want an in depth idol raising game, I'm assuming there are better. I've never have, or will, play another Idol game because it doesn't look interesting. The Music videos seem complex, but once you realize that moving the camera continuously gives you nonstop points, it becomes about wiggling the camera instead of capturing a good video. I heard it was impossible to lose and I did have to basically force my idol into retirement by never letting her rest to get the bad ending. I can't see you using up all the days up even if you tried. It's a simple game with a simple goal and simple execution. So I give it the simple rating of two stars or four out of ten. I judge 5 as a standard game, so it's worth a look, but don't expect much.

I had previously bought the Xbox One Stereo Adapter to use headphones, but I wanted a headset with a built-in microphone so that I could chat while playing. The microphone on this headset seems fine, and the fit was decent (still a little tight for my large head), but the audio quality was much lower than other headphone sets I've used. Even the headphones that came with my iPhone had better audio than this headset. The sound was very boomy and bass-heavy, to the point where I felt like I was listening to my game through a closed door. I could hear what was going on, but it felt much less crisp and more detached from the game. It felt like I was playing with a head cold.

product_title: Revo K101 Plus Crystal Clear Emulator Game Handheld Mp3 Player
review_headline: Quality is NOT guaranteed with the Revo K101+ and the creator has a very poor level of service for his customers.
review_body:
Let me just say that I think what the Revo K101+ can do is neat, but so far I have had some bad experiences with it which also led to a poor experience with the creator.

Pros: Rom playback, screen brightness, video output

Cons: Soft plastic (like most Chinese items) which easily scratches
GBA resolution is actually stretched about 50% to fill the screen (more pixelated image)
Buttons are not as responsive as the GBA(seems to be a farther press to get an input in game)
Some of the buttons seem to stick if you slide your finger off of a depressed button
My audio port fell off of the PCB board just from plugging in headphones

My Story:
I ordered one on May 15th, 2015 and it arrived until August 11th, 2015. Nearly 2 months! I suppose there must be only one guy working on these. I am not sure.

When it arrived, I realized that it did not come with everything listed on the website. The screen protector and earbuds were not included. I thought it was a minor issue so I ignored it. I was happy that it finally arrived. I first tested the video output on my TV and it worked as expected. It's my favorite feature. Next, I tested out the roms that were included and everything worked well. I mainly want to play original Gameboy games.

I then decided to check out how the audio works with my headphones. This is where the problems begin. I go to plug in my 1/8" audio jack and the entire port goes straight into the console like it was barely attached to the motherboard. I immediately contacted the creator and it took me 3 days to get him to understand what happened. I'm aware of the language barrier so I had to be patient with him.

Once he finally understood, I asked for a replacement, but he told me that he couldn't do that and that I would have to sell it to someone who wouldn't mind a missing audio port. I told him that was not acceptable for a defective item and then he offered me $5 offmy next order of the Crystal Black model. We went about 10 days of back and forth emails. I just wanted to return it and he just sending me a replacement when the next batch rolls out. He refused everything I asked him and he eventually sent me a measly $10 refund to my Paypal. After all of the frustration, I just accepted it. I know I could have disputed through Paypal, but that would have taken weeks and required me to pay $10 just to return ship. I thought it was best to just deal without an audio port.

I ended up taking it apart to remove the audio port that was rattling around inside and I noticed that there is very little solder on most of the contacts. I may attempt to solder it back on, though I have little skills to do so.

I just want to let everyone know that quality is not guaranteed with the Revo K101+. The creator was not rude, but I had a difficult time getting my problem solved for the broken audio port.

product_title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Legendary Edition
review_headline: The Best RPG made to date!
review_body: Skyrim is beautiful and harsh, it is ambitious and buggy, but that is why it is the best RPG to date and one of the best video games to date. Bethesda is no newbie to the RPG world and Skyrim is the fifth installment of an already very well developed video game franchise and virtual world. Tamriel is a huge land full of rich history, lore, legends and adventures and Skyrim further developes Tamriel even more than it already is. Skyrim is easy to play, easy to learn and really tailors well to individual styles of play. Skyrim is a true Open World game and one of my favorites in the genre (only surpassed by Fallout: New Vegas because the amount of control you have over the events and outcomes of that game is astounding). Skyrim has a wonderful and rich storyline and gameplay. It can easily entertain for 200+ hours on just the base game. That being said it is worth the extra money to buy the legendary edition - you won't regret it. The legendary edition adds hundreds more hours of game play not to mention a separate land (Solstheim) and 2 separate worlds (Soul Cairn and the Forgotten Vale)  and the ability to build your own house (within limits). I own Skyrim on 2 platforms the base game on the Xbox 360 and the Legendary edition on the PC. I would strongly advise that you buy Skyrim for the PC. If PC has the ability to play Skyrim than mods can really rejuvenate and enhance a 4 year old game and make it feel new again not to mention add hundreds of hours to game play, improve game play, fix bugs, and allows you even more customization than you already had to begin with. So if you ever need a new game to play Skyrim is the way to go. Always.

With EA ACCESS I got to play the game for 10 hours this weekend. Lets start by saying this is a solid football sim that gives us something that is better then nothing. With no competition it really is hard for EA to innovate anything ground breaking. Some people will get excited for the new pass catching buttons. However if you play on All-Pro or above they add little to nothing in value. Half the time the button you press isn't what happens anyway. The New fantasy draft mode is fun once or twice but isn't something we will all be playing 6 months from now. Micro-transaction Ultimate football is back and as lame as ever. Touted as the most played mode in Madden I don't know a single person who plays Ultimate team mode. If you like paying more money to get into a fantasy draft franchise go for it the rest of us are laughing at you.

Honestly Madden has because something of a standard then a trend setter. You get what you expect with a few new fresh coats of paint each year. Its not a bad game, it doesn't deserve 1, 2 or even 3 stars. Its a solid 4 star experience that needs some competition to push it to the next level. If you can wait until November the game will be 10-20 bucks cheaper as it is every year.

With all that said I have to recommend EA Access for nothing else than the Discount on games. I went in thinking that the 10 hour trial wasn't worth the 5 bucks I paid for EA Access however when I purchased Madden from the Xbox live store I only paid $53.00. Essentially it saved me 2 bucks and I got the trial free.

product_title: Turtle Beach Ear Force XP SEVEN MLG Pro Circuit Programmable Surround Sound Console Headset
review_headline: Worst Customer Service in History, Mediocre bad-fitting headset.
review_body:
This headset is the single worst customer experience I have had in my life.

It broke within 2 months of opening it, when only using it a few times a week. I sent it in for warranty replacement, and it has been there ever since. They sent back a broken replacement without the cables, then they sent the wrong cable, then I sent everything back again and I still have no headset. I paid nearly $400 dollars, and I have literally nothing to show for it but frustration. The warranty case with turtle beach was opened on June 19. Months later, I still have no headset. The customer service is atrocious. They are sarcastic and dismissive, and have no idea what they are doing. I am convinced they are only trying to prevent warranty replacements from happening. Here is an actual excerpt from one of the emails they sent me:

"The cable you received for use is exactly the same in all functions. Color change and the angle on the plug do not alter its core function, which is why you received it. Thank you for eventually trying to use it so we could verify if your problem was cleared up or not.
Is this the exact same problem you had previous? As the full headset was swapped out and the cable as well we want to be sure the acu is not at fault in this case.
The XP7 is not available in a finished good replacement fashion. That is partly why we replaced just the headset in the first place as you had indicated an issue with just it."

I can not believe how paying absolute top dollar for a supposed "best of the best" headset has cost me time, money, and left me with nothing. I have been patient, and all I received from Turtle beach are pre-canned messages and outright lies.

The headset itself is mediocre at best. The leather was decent enough, but the band is not really adjustable (height but not width) and there is a rattling squeaking noise when you move your head around while wearing it. The audio quality is good - if a bit bass heavy. Clarity is lacking and there are MAJOR issues with the driver and software that the USB ACU use to create the digital surround. I had to use optical audio to get it to properly have separate volume control for chat and talk - so if you don't have optical - this is a bad choice.

I would literally buy ANY other headset than this one. This Turtle Beach has been the worst experience I have ever had buying something anywhere, let alone the internet. The company happens to have 27 claims against them with the Better Business Bureau already, and will be getting another shortly.

If the technology were the best, it still would not be worth dealing with the company. But the fact is its not even that great of a product to begin with. The mediocre sound and poor craftsmanship (only nice thing is the soft leather) leave you with a bad product for an egregious price. And god forbid you get one of the many lemons they ship out. You will be in warranty replacement hell until you give up.

Shame on TurtleBeach, this was my fourth headset I bought from them - but I will never allow anyone I know, not even a complete stranger, to suffer through what I have been through. Please, if you have any self respect at all, if you want a headset that works, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.MAJOR issues with the driver and software that the USB ACU use to create the digital surround. I had to use optical audio to get it to properly have separate volume control for chat and talk - so if you don't have optical - this is a bad choice. I would literally buy ANY other headset than this one. This Turtle Beach has been the worst experience I have ever had buying something anywhere, let alone the internet. The company happens to have 27 claims against them with the Better Business Bureau already, and will be getting another shortly. If the technology were the best, it still would not be worth dealing with the company. But the fact is its not even that great of a product to begin with. The mediocre sound and poor craftsmanship (only nice thing is the soft leather) leave you with a bad product for an egregious price. And god forbid you get one of the many lemons they ship out. You will be in warranty replacement hell until you give up. Shame on TurtleBeach, this was my fourth headset I bought from them - but I will never allow anyone I know, not even a complete stranger, to suffer through what I have been through. Please, if you have any self respect at all, if you want a headset that works, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
If you liked Heavy Rain, Beyond Two Souls, or any of the TellTale games, this will be right up your alley.  Plus this is also one of the most beautiful games I have ever seen!

product_title: Ultimate Stealth Triple Pack (Thief, Hitman: Absolution, Deus Ex: Human Revolution)- Xbox 360
review_body:
I think whether or not you like this product depends entirely on your opinion of the games. I was largely disappointed with Thief, but I think that's due to my high hopes and I have played the game Dishonored before I played Thief. (Dishonored is inspired by Thief but it turns out to be far superior in many ways). Deus Ex was phenomenal (Not necessarily a stealth game. Think: if the Fallout series and the Crysis series had a baby, it would be Deus Ex HR) and I have yet to finish Hitman, but it's pretty good as well. As for the physical product, the package includes three disks and no game booklets/instructions. All three disks are mostly black with a big ULTIMATE STEALTH on top with the actual game's name being relatively small, so it takes an extra second to identify which game is which.

OVERALL - The above are hardly valid complaints and the Ultimate Stealth Triple Pack is a perfectly acceptable product. Three stars because Thief made me sad.

Until Dawn is an interactive, story based horror adventure game.  The narrative is well written and is inspired by the 80's and 90's "slasher" horror films (Friday the 13th, Halloween, Saw) as well as supernatural horror.  From the beginning, the characters and the setting are intentionally stereotypical: A group of upper/middle class teenagers in an isolated region of the country side.  Even the character archetypes are all reminiscent of the typical horror flicks that are released around October: The jock, the clown, the arrogant cheerleader, the attractive 'nerdy' girl, the token minority, etc..  The setting for the story is designed in such a way to induce a constant feeling of isolation in the player. Add to this the excellent ambient sound quality plus the top-notch graphics (even by the standards of a PC gamer), and you have for yourself one atmospheric and engaging adventure game.  UD is simply much more than "just another interactive movie." This is because the optional element of exploration not only fleshes out the details of the main story, but can potentially change its course with regards to death/survival of each character.  Simply put, the more one explores the various dark and eerie areas, the more he/she will feel rewarded.  Another aspect of the game is the knowledge that even the smallest decisions can have drastic consequences.  I will not go into too much detail regarding this "Butterfly Effect" for the sake of keeping the review as spoiler-free as possible.  Suffice to say, it is intended to make the player ponder his/her every move and adds replayability to the game.  What UD isn't:  The horror elements in this game are based on the aforementioned movie genre.  Hence, you will witness elements of gore, jump scares, eerie music, mystery, etc...  Do not expect the same type of horror as in games such as Amnesia or Condemned.  The game is also heavily story-driven with simple control mechanics.  The gameplay is not meantto be complex or challenging.  Pros: -Well-written, engaging story -Multiple characters with distinct personalities -Atmospheric and immersive environments -Exploration is rewarding and helps to flesh out the story -Multiple playthroughs yield different outcomes  Cons: -occasional frame rate drops. -Simple gameplay mechanics could possibly turn off the more hardcore gamer -Some might initially find the story/characters too cliche.

EA Sports returns it's gridiron game to the masses in Madden NFL 16. This year's game host new features and old favorites that should appeal to anyone who has been a fan of the Madden Series. I will go over all the different modes you have to play. One of the new features that brings a whole new experience to the game is Be the Playmaker. You now have three different catch options to chose from. They are as follows.

1. Aggressive catch: This is a high risk/high reward option. Say you are down a score with little time remaining on the clock and need a big play. Using the aggressive catch could provide you the score or yardage needed to win the game. But beware, your receiver has a lower chance of catching the ball. It could however, be just the thing to lead your team to victory. It's all up to you now.

2. Possession catch: You this when you need a clutch pass to your receiver. You most likely won't get any additional yards after the catch but it comes in handy when you need a big play from your QB and receiver.

3. RAC Catch: Look to use this play when you need your receiver to make the big play and turn it up the field for more addition yardage after the catch. I would only use this when he's pen because you do have a much bigger chance of throwing an interception id he's cover well.

Another new feature in this year's game is called Draft Champions. I will be honest, when I first heard about this new mode of play, I was not impressed at all. I thought, here we go, another new gimmick I won't be playing. I could have not been more wrong. When I fired up the menu, I saw the Draft Champions mode and said, what the heck, I will give it a try. Now, I'm glad I did. If you are a fan and like playing Fantasy Football as much as I do, this is where you will be spending a lot of your gaming hours in Madden NFL 16. It brings the Fantasy Football aspect to Madden in a way that fun and enjoyable to everyone.

The Gatorade Skills Trainer Mode: This is a great place to brush up on your Madden skills. Whether you are a long time player of the game like myself or just starting out, you can learn the ins and outs of the game and the new features that were added to Madden NFL 16.

The Gauntlet: This mode was first introduced in last year's game. It's basically a series of drills that will help you become a better overall Madden player. It's a great way to try and beat your scores and improve your overall game.

Connected Franchise Mode: A lot of new additions to CFM makes this a more enjoyable experience for guys looking to create and control your favorite NFL Franchise. Everything from a new way to scout your players to giving the Commissioner more options to make your online CFM run a lot smoother than year's past. It's still not perfect by any means but it does show promise for future Madden games.

Online Head to Head: If you enjoy playing your friends, family or just looking to for a game to play, this is the mode for you. See how you stack up against some of the best Madden players in the world by going online.

Ultimate Team Mode: Build your NFL Dream Team in this mode. Long time fans will enjoy yet another Season of MUT in Madden NFL 16. I know a lot of guys will spend a lot of time and effort in creating their Ultimate Team. The more wins you get, the more coins you can earn in order to strengthen your squad.

Practice Mode: Need some extra time with your team to learn harness your Madden skills, then practice mode is for you. Learn your team's playbook backwards and forwards by spending time going over your go to plays. It's time well spent if you are a serious Madden gamer.

Super Bowl 50: It's the Pittsburgh Steelers vs. the Arizona Cardinals in this fictional Super Bowl 50 matchup. You can replay this opening of Madden NFL 16 as many times as you want. It's a great way to get a taste of the game.

In closing,Madden NFL 16 is just a flat out fun game to play for anyone who has enjoyed previous versions of the Madden series. It's not without is faults however, but has more than enough good traits to keep you coming back for more. This is the game Madden fans have been waiting for. I, for one, am glad Madden Season is finally upon us!

For anyone accustomed to sports games, they basically know a new year normally means an updated roster, different menus and maybe one or two new features to entice the consumer to pick it up. Madden NFL 16 for the next gen Playstation 4 and Xbox One will contain the new features that are highlighted in commercials and reviews. But for last gen, absolutely nothing is changed. It's the same game as last year, just with a nice hefty sixty dollar price tag. If you own Madden NFL 15, or heck, the last two before that. You're basically getting the same game.

If the updated roster means anything then I guess I would barely recommend it. But even then I would suggest waiting for the price to drop. Not everyone can afford the Playstation 4 as of yet, but that shouldn't give EA the right to give consumers an identical copy of last years game and expect players to be happy paying full price for a inferior version. The only other positive of buying the newest Madden on PS3 is that the previous game will have less players to match up against sense its outdated, and having the newer version would most likely give you more opponents to play against.

The PS3 like any other last gen console will always get inferior ports until the system retires, it's the way the business works. This review was just meant as a warning to anyone who may not be familiar with EA's lovely practice of releasing carbon copies for everyone to be disappointed in.

review_headline: Another mediocre product lacking inspiration and innovation.
review_body:
I feel like I have to place a disclaimer at the beginning of this review for those that absolutely love the game and despise anyone who thinks differently: I hope this review doesn't offend you. This is my opinion. Don't get cranky because I don't like this game.

With that out of the way, this is another year of EA sucking $60 out of wallets for not much more than upgraded rosters. This is another year where the mechanics of the game feel just like every other Madden game. Another year of these 'new' features promised by EA to 'change the game' when I don't believe that is the case at all. EA has done a great job at 'forcing' consumers to purchase the new game each year just so they can enjoy new rosters. I'm honestly curious as to how many people would actually purchase the game each year if EA offered roster updates for the previous year as well. My guess is that they would lose out on a lot of money. For that reason alone, it makes sense for them to lock down the fact that users have to buy the new game if they want to play with the new people. As a corporation, I get it. As a consumer that has to spend $60 for that being the (for the most part) largest feature each year, it pisses me off.

These 'new' additions of Total Control Passing and Integrated Broadcast Graphics are the same features that EA boasts are new and improved each year. If you'll recall from Madden 15, EA released a 'Best of Broadcast' function that claimed to include new broadcast and cameras that capture the emotion of every play from fresh new perspectives. The Integrated Broadcast Graphics of this year claim that the playmaker highlight reel has new player spotlights, dynamic goals and achievements, and innovative on-the-field cameras that bring you closer to the game than ever before. I just feel like EA is beating a dead horse each year, and I'm fed up with it.

I find myself buying these games each year with the hope that EA will produce a game that feels fresh and new, deserving of a new $60 rather than pumping out roster updates and claiming to be the newest and best. Unfortunately, this is going to be my last Madden purchase until I see something that is actually game changing. I'll stick with a previous version and just download my own custom rosters that fellow Madden lovers provide to the community.

I wish I had positive things to say about this game, but I don't. I'm just tired of pretending that this is a great game just because it's new. Maybe I'm getting older and finding that this isn't what I'm looking for in a new game. Maybe I'm just coming to terms with the fact that the Madden franchise just isn't what it used to be. Whatever the case may be, it pains me to say that I don't like this game, but I'm not scared to admit it anymore.ew $60 rather than pumping out roster updates and claiming to be the newest and best. Unfortunately, this is going to be my last Madden purchase until I see something that is actually game changing. I'll stick with a previous version and just download my own custom rosters that fellow Madden lovers provide to the community. I wish I had positive things to say about this game, but I don't. I'm just tired of pretending that this is a great game just because it's new. Maybe I'm getting older and finding that this isn't what I'm looking for in a new game. Maybe I'm just coming to terms with the fact that the Madden franchise just isn't what it used to be. Whatever the case may be, it pains me to say that I don't like this game, but I'm not scared to admit it anymore.

product_title: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition - Xbox One
review_body: Almost a decade ago the original gears came out revolutionizing the gaming industry and setting a new bar for next gen multiplayer gaming. It was the first game to allow you to do in multiplayer exactly what you could do in campaign. It had amazing graphics for its time and  revolutionizing gameplay. This is the version of the game the developers would've loved to release since Emergence Day 2006. Graphics are improved, amazing and so smooth. The gameplay is the same as the original gears (No crazy weapons or frag tagging walls like later gears). A must have for any fan of the series or noobs alike. I don't blame you if you run around chainsawing opponents the first few hours.

The only difference is this game puts more emphasis on cooking, something that either wasn't in the past games I played or I just didn't pay attention to it. The game's relaxing, but it can sometimes get tedious because you're gonna find yourself doing the same things over and over, every day, to keep the farm running.

product_title: Xbox One Kinect Sensor with Dance Central Spotlight
review_headline: The Kinect itself is pretty fun, Dance Central Spotlight is very passable and forgetable.
review_body: The Kinect in general is pretty fun.  It definitely needs some work, especially if you are a tall guy like me, but it is a lot of fun to play with the family.  I would highly recommend getting a mount for it and placing it over your TV.  That seems to help things out a lot.  As far as Dance Central Spotlight, you could really do without this game.  It is easy to see why it comes free with the Kinect as it is mostly a money grab game.  It comes with 8 songs, and you have to download any other song you want at about $1.99 a piece.  The game doesn't play real well with the Kinect either, you'll spend a lot of time trying to get it to recognize you and your motions.

Great game. Unfortunately, when they say "STARTER Pack", they are not kidding. The "Trapmasters", the major characters, of which there are 18 (one is included in this starter pack), are generally about $15 apiece. You really need one from each category (or elements in the game) to access all the locked areas. From what I can tell, about four of them have passed into 'collectible' status, meaning their price is in the $40 range or more if you can find them.

Then there are the Traps, $5-6 apiece, ten categories (elements in the game) . . .

Then the minor characters . . .

Eternal optimist that I am, it is a good game, easy for the player (whatever the age) to become hooked. Therefore the multitude of characters could be used as bribes, rewards or other persuasion . . . (your mileage may vary . . . )

review_headline: Gave me memories of the great battle of speakers in 1845
review_body:
Was very excited to play this game. I have heard nothing but great reviews, and I enjoy it when games decide to try and rip off the walking dead.

Sadly, this game is very scary, and midway through the game I saw a pair of speakers and instantly I got reminded of when I was in battle in 1845 with general cornhog with nothing but a crowbar.

The great battle of speakers was in full view; everywhere I looked the speakers were trying to take over the world and it was up to us, and the pigs of Africa, to take back the land. In the end 230,948 speakers died in the process.

It was not until 1990 when radio shack game along and made peace with the speakers.

Anyway the game is terrible 0/6 stars I hope you enjoyed my review.

review_headline: A great alternative for those sick of first person shooters
review_body: This is how I know it is a great game... not only is the campaign a fun experience.. online is still fun even if you suck for the most part like I do.

EA Sports returns it's gridiron game to the masses in Madden NFL 16. This year's game host new features and old favorites that should appeal to anyone who has been a fan of the Madden Series. I will go over all the different modes you have to play. One of the new features that brings a whole new experience to the game is Be the Playmaker. You now have three different catch options to chose from. They are as follows.

1. Aggressive catch: This is a high risk/high reward option. Say you are down a score with little time remaining on the clock and need a big play. Using the aggressive catch could provide you the score or yardage needed to win the game. But beware, your receiver has a lower chance of catching the ball. It could however, be just the thing to lead your team to victory. It's all up to you now.

2. Possession catch: You this when you need a clutch pass to your receiver. You most likely won't get any additional yards after the catch but it comes in handy when you need a big play from your QB and receiver.

3. RAC Catch: Look to use this play when you need your receiver to make the big play and turn it up the field for more addition yardage after the catch. I would only use this when he's pen because you do have a much bigger chance of throwing an interception id he's cover well.

Another new feature in this year's game is called Draft Champions. I will be honest, when I first heard about this new mode of play, I was not impressed at all. I thought, here we go, another new gimmick I won't be playing. I could have not been more wrong. When I fired up the menu, I saw the Draft Champions mode and said, what the heck, I will give it a try. Now, I'm glad I did. If you are a fan and like playing Fantasy Football as much as I do, this is where you will be spending a lot of your gaming hours in Madden NFL 16. It brings the Fantasy Football aspect to Madden in a way that fun and enjoyable to everyone.

The Gatorade Skills Trainer Mode: This is a great place to brush up on your Madden skills. Whether you are a long time player of the game like myself or just starting out, you can learn the ins and outs of the game and the new features that were added to Madden NFL 16.

The Gauntlet: This mode was first introduced in last year's game. It's basically a series of drills that will help you become a better overall Madden player. It's a great way to try and beat your scores and improve your overall game.

Connected Franchise Mode: A lot of new additions to CFM makes this a more enjoyable experience for guys looking to create and control your favorite NFL Franchise. Everything from a new way to scout your players to giving the Commissioner more options to make your online CFM run a lot smoother than year's past. It's still not perfect by any means but it does show promise for future Madden games.

Online Head to Head: If you enjoy playing your friends, family or just looking to for a game to play, this is the mode for you. See how you stack up against some of the best Madden players in the world by going online.

Ultimate Team Mode: Build your NFL Dream Team in this mode. Long time fans will enjoy yet another Season of MUT in Madden NFL 16. I know a lot of guys will spend a lot of time and effort in creating their Ultimate Team. The more wins you get, the more coins you can earn in order to strengthen your squad.

Practice Mode: Need some extra time with your team to learn harness your Madden skills, then practice mode is for you. Learn your team's playbook backwards and forwards by spending time going over your go to plays. It's time well spent if you are a serious Madden gamer.

Super Bowl 50: It's the Pittsburgh Steelers vs. the Arizona Cardinals in this fictional Super Bowl 50 matchup. You can replay this opening of Madden NFL 16 as many times as you want. It's a great way to get a taste of the game.

In closing,Madden NFL 16 is just a flat out fun game to play for anyone who has enjoyed previous versions of the Madden series. It's not without is faults however, but has more than enough good traits to keep you coming back for more. This is the game Madden fans have been waiting for. I, for one, am glad Madden Season is finally upon us!

An immensely diverting game.  Plenty of stealth, deliberation, strategy, and reward for being careful and thoughtful about how you proceed.  Deployables can be retrieved (a great jump forward from SE2).  The North African setting is compelling, and particular care is taken to reproduce vehicles and equipment with excellent attention to detail.  It has the "kill cam," for the bloodthirsty amongst us, and there's nothing like arcing a 500 meter shot right into the forehead of your objective.  Have played through multiple times, and it remains extremely enjoyable.  While it can be played as a twitch fest (just fire off an unmasked shot and then tackle the enemies that come running), it's vastly more rewarding to sneak through the levels, taking stealth kills, masked shots, and laying traps.  Tremendous fun.

review_headline: Just as good as the Wii U version
review_body:
First off, the roster. It has over 50 characters, including Mario, Link, Pikachu, Kirby, Samus, Sonic, Donkey Kong, Mega Man, and even Pac-Man. Of course I'm not going to list everyone but those are some of the most recognizable ones. By far the biggest and best roster in the entire series. Everyone that should be there is.

Next one's pretty important, the physics. It's absolutely nowhere near the fast paced, aggressive style of Melee. There's hitstun, but only a little bit, meaning that you'll only be able to truly combo at low percents since they'll be hit closer to you. Everybody still floats like a piece of paper, and you have unlimited air dodges. Shields are nearly indestructible and regenerate very quickly, and you can shieldgrab pretty much everything. So defensive gameplay is the norm, which I real hate but eh. You just have to adjust and you'll be fine.

Online: It's terrible. Unless of course everyone you play has good Internet. You can set up a room for your friends, send and view replays or play one of the 2 main modes: For Fun and For Glory. For Fun is a lagfest where you play will all items on for 2 minutes. Most people just go there to do "taunt parties" where they just mess around and not attack each other. You can try to crash the party but you'll just get ganged up on. For Glory is a 1v1, 2 stock battle which is still a little bit laggy but not unbearable. I much prefer this on the 3DS version since the 3DS doesn't use tags, which Wii U people can use to swear at you after you beat them. The worst they can do on the 3DS version is furiously flash their name by choosing a character over and over.

Game modes: Way better than the Wii U version because 2 words: Smash. Tour. Smash Tour is an absolute blast. You fight a bunch of different enemies while collecting stat boosts across a huge map. At the end you'll either do some sort of Smash match, have a race, or climb a tower to decide the winner. I seriously consider this a reason to get this over the Wii U version since all it has is some slow boring board game called Trash Tour. Other modes are Home Run contest, where you try to hit a sandbag as far as possible (Pst, use Ganonorf and use his reverse B instead of the bat) and Target Blast, which is pretty much launching a bomb bird from Angry Birds. You have to hit a bomb to break wooden obstacles for the best score.

As usual there's Classic Mode and All Star like all Smash games. This time in classic mode, you set the difficulty on a scale of 0.0 to 9.0, much like Kid Icarus Uprising (Sakurai bias lel) and each round you have to choose one of three paths.

And now there's DLC. It's kinda overpriced in my opinion ($2 per stage, $5 per character) but LUCAS IS BACK so I doesn't freaking matter.

Amiibos are basically just a CPU you can train yourself. It'll also give you cool stuff, like gear and trophies. You can go get a Mario amiibo at WalMart for about $12. Don't worry there's a billion of 'em. If you want any other character you can get them from those lovely scalpers for around 60-70 bucks.

This game also introduces custom moves, which lets you change a character's B move (Ex: Changing Mario's Fireball to Fast Fireball) and give them equipment, which you can use to make them faster, stronger, or more defensive.

You can save pictures by pausing the game and pressing L/R. All of your pictures are saved to the album AND 3DS Camera. You can attach that picture to make a Miiverse post (Don't expect anyone to notice it since the Snapshot Community is dead)

And of course, it's portable. Smash anywhere. It's awesome. Biggest thing this one has over the Wii U version besides Smash Run.

tl;dr its cool buy itider this a reason to get this over the Wii U version since all it has is some slow boring board game called Trash Tour. You have to hit a bomb to break wooden obstacles for the best score.

As usual there's Classic Mode and All Star like all Smash games. This time in classic mode, you set the difficulty on a scale of 0.0 to 9.0, much like Kid Icarus Uprising (Sakurai bias lel) and each round you have to choose one of three paths.

And now there's DLC. It's kinda overpriced in my opinion ($2 per stage, $5 per character) but LUCAS IS BACK so I doesn't freaking matter.

Amiibos are basically just a CPU you can train yourself. It'll also give you cool stuff, like gear and trophies. You can go get a Mario amiibo at WalMart for about $12. Don't worry there's a billion of 'em. If you want any other character you can get them from those lovely scalpers for around 60-70 bucks.

product_title: HORI amiibo Collect and Display Case for Nintendo amiibo Figures
review_body:
Ok, after reading other reviews from others who purchased these, here are the points they were right on: 1)The plastic isn't as clear as it could be 2)They are stackable 3)Bulkier Amiibo do fit well. I also agree with the poster who said "There should be a flat rate for a case of them."

Now as for my opinions/experiences: 1)They are a very sturdy made product 2)They can be scanned on your Wii U pad and your 3DS with the Amiibo pad option. The down side is they don't always read so well because the case bases are big and a little unhandy which leads to my next point 3)While the case measurements are nice they take up more space than you might expect. If you only a casual collector that just has a few Amiibo these are great. They are also great for the serious collector(like myself) keep in mind the space they take up. I do love being able to display them and can still use them for playing games. I would give this 4 and a half stars if this rating system could.

Update: I have ordered a few more of these and the plastic is clearer than the first batch. Maybe Hori got the memo from the one who brought up that complaint. Also these cases will not hold the amiibo/skylanders, Hammer Slam Bowser and Turbo Charge Donkey Kong and while it will house Yarn Yoshi they will not stay in place.

Update: I heard that these cases are going to be discontinued. I managed to get many of them from GameStop because they are marked down half price. I bought all the ones within a hundred mile radius of me. They are shipped to my main store. With the huge amount of Amiibo from May to July for a total of 15 this year I figured this product would be in more demand than ever.
If you are looking for these try the GameStop stores near your area too. They should ship any and all from a hundred mile radius to the main store you haunt. Good luck.

review_headline: If you love horror movies, you gotta play this game.
review_body:
I really wish I pre-ordered this game because it was a hard time to find the actual game at a store. I went through a Best Buy, GameStop, Target, and then finally ended at another GameStop where they had only three copies left in stock (I had to call ahead to reserve one).

Anyways, when I finally got home and popped the disc into my PS4, I was already getting anxious whenever I stumbled upon the main menu. The music of the game was already immersing me into the eerie state of the story, I had goosebumps of an incoming fear.

I haven't completed the game yet but after playing through about an hour of it, I'm already amazed. I think the last time I jumped so much was when I played P.T. for the first (Silent Hills Playable Teaser). There was one scene where my wireless headset almost broke because I literally flew out of my chair in fear and my headset went flying off my head (thankfully my soft carpet broke its fall), but make sure you bring extra pairs of underwear before hitting "New Game" on the main menu.

A feature I really like about the game is how you can see how a character's relationship with another character changes as you make decisions along the story that effect that character.

In the final verdict, I recommend this game to anyone who loves the horror genre in general. Someone who loves getting scared by endless jump-scares, following along the personalities of a variety of characters, and being immersed into a story that makes you think and sit at the edge of your chair. P.S. Seriously, at least consider my underwear advise.

EA is pushing its developers to churn out content while ignoring identified issues in the software.

Since March (which may be the release date), there have been reports of the bakery/retail issues being acknowledged by EA but remaining unfixed. This has significantly impacted gameplay.

The two that I've experienced so far (in August) are:

1) Employees are not checking out customers.

2) Customers will not buy from the warming case or lice freezer case.

The impacts are that you need to either work harder or pull someone from your home to help with the shop and two, more significantly, is that you can't keep customers in the store to eat their goods and spend more time.

A traditional display case is used which keeps it preserved long enough to sell most of the time or traditional tables.

With Sims 3 and 2, significant game playing bugs were corrected within a month or two.. or three.. but we're almost at 6 months and major bugs aren't being addressed while content is being parsed out for maximum $$ as quickly as possible.

This change in direction is sad and it's significantly impacting the quality.

Madden doesn't bring many surprises. I mean, if it ain't broke don't fix it, right? Well, while Madden 16 isn't broken, its certainly not great. Graphics and presentation are pretty decent, but the recycled commentary gets old after 3 games. The big new gameplay changes are catching modifications (Highlight reel catches, possession catches, running after the catch, etc) and double-tapping a button to lob a pass. Brilliant. Where are the new Connected Franchise features? What about a new revamped "Superstar Mode" similar to the amazing one in the "NBA 2K" series? Absent. Draft Champions is a cool new mode, but not nearly enough to be a groundbreaking difference. If you were underwhelmed by Madden 15, there is NOTHING in '16 that will change that mindset.

This game was great, but the online services have been shut down. You wont be able to play online or with anyone else, just start up maps and sit there by yourself offline, unless you play in your house on a LAN or over hamachi. Glu mobil bought the company that runs Battlefront 1&2 (and several other good games) and shut the servers down in 2014. EA bought the licence, and are making a Starwars Battlefront 3 (without the 3 in the name) but they are known for shutting down servers also. I used to host games online for this game, it was awesome.

Only 16v16 players unlike battlefieds 64v64, but the maps were too small for more players. The flying in battlefront2 was better on some maps then the first game by far. The land vehicles are mostly very well done, almost perfect except for one tank on the clonewars maps.

I wonder if EA could help the community make a patch to fix its online server browser. These servers are very very very cheap to run once set up, there is no reason for a company to ever shut one down, with virtual machines it dosnt even need to be a separate computer, for 15k they could build a computer to run almost every EA game from 1996-2009 online servers (since alot fewer players play them then they used to).
Their bandwidth would be as small as the amount of people wanting to play these games online still are in the hundreds not hundreds of thousands anymore. Guildwars 1 by NCsoft will be running as long as a single person is playing and it runs on the spare bandwidth of GW2 on a old server in a closet.

product_title: Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed - PlayStation Vita
review_body: This is a horde control game, like the Dynasty Warriors series, with the Neptunia games as a base. That's about it. There isn't much story, but the character interactions are good. The game isn't hard, but it's fun to play. The main complaint is the dress break system, but if you avoid getting hit at all, you can go the whole game without experiencing it once, since you can get unbreakable clothes after a few rounds with a character. If you're on the fence, wait until Ultraviolence Dimension: Neptune + Blanc vs. Zombie Corp. comes out, which will be an improved version of this. If you want it, get it now, because the Japanese release for the above is still unscheduled, let alone an American one.

product_title: Ortz PS4 Vertical Stand with Cooling Fan - Controller Charging Station with Dual Charger
review_body:
So, this thing was awesome for the amount of time it worked...And then, lo and behold, it stopped working just the day before yesterday - all in all, it lasted from May 11 to August 23 - a grand total of 104 days - the only reason I gave it 2 stars was due to the fact it just simply didn't last long....so very, very sad...and now, I'm shopping for another and I keep seeing this one with 400+ reviews and I want to try it again because it worked great for the time it did work....*shaking head* Decisions, decisions....

Besides the glaring issue with its lack of longevity, there were three other issues - and one is more of a design issue. I've noted that some of the simple plastic stands have tabs that seem to make the console more stable on its base that insert into the groove along the side of the PS4 - it's fairly stable; however, I feel that these tabs would make it even more so....Additionally, one of the rubber pads underneath the thing magically came off. I'm blaming the gnomes....Not sure what the story was there - And the other one has to do with after having it for a couple of months, the fans would occasionally start making the most horrendous noise like they were in pain (if machines were capable of screaming obviously). I would then turn it on and off again to make it stop. Sometimes that would work...sometimes not so much....in that case, you would have to sort of thump it a few times....finally it would start working again just fine...

product_title: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition - Xbox One
review_body: It's my fault for not reading more into what you get with this product, but I'm still very disappointed and feel duped. All you get with this is Gears of War 1 remastered. It's a $40 game that you can get for $4 on the Xbox 360. No Gears of War 2, 3, Judgment, Horde mode, Beast mode, anything. I would've been happy if they just put Horde mode in it, but nope, all you can do with other players is Co-op campaign with one other person or deathmatch online.  As for the remaster, the only difference between the Xbox One and Xbox 360 versions, it's basically just upscaled to 1080p. It's not like the Halo collection where they redid the entire first game into a modern one. You get the same textures, same look, made without the grainy lines of 480p. Is that really worth $40?  I wish I could take this back for a refund so I can buy ten Xbox 360 games instead, but I doubt that's an option since I've already opened it. I'm a sucker.

review_headline: Perfect clash of adventure, adrenaline, and story.
review_body:
I haven't been hooked on a game in years, nor do I like zombie games, but this is an amazing game.

Pros:
1) there aren't many jump scares. This game uses fantastic music and ambience to make you feel intense moments. Sneaking around at night and being caugh in a chase really feel amazing.
2) The graphics are great. Even for low end systems it seems they run decent enough to fully enjoy the game.
3) The story contains characters you will like as the grow.

Cons:
1) The mouths of the characters talking sucks.
2) Lots of fetch quests. However, this isn't a huge con, as you will find out the running in this game is one of the best parts. It's not like a boring drive in GTA it's always enjoyable to find routes and gaps to jump.

Don't buy this for young children as it is violent. Do buy this if you like good games and want one that really shines above the rest.

review_headline: Best RPG Bethesda has ever made.
review_body: I bought Morrowind way back when it first came out in 2002 at the age of 10 with some birthday money and never looked at video games the same again. I've recently purchased another copy for the Xbox out of nostalgia and the game still holds up. You boot up the game, create and name your avatar, and finish a short tutorial to get you familiar with the games mechanics... and then you're set loose it an absolutely huge game world with basically no direction besides meeting a contact. You can do the main storyline if you want, or none of it. You can do any number of guild missions for mages, fighters, thieves, assassins, the army, or religious groups. There are a number of quests unrelated to any factions as well. All of these quests you can either take up or completely ignore. You can become a vampire (or a werewolf with Bloodmoon), and reap all the pros and cons of each transformation. Even better, the GOTY edition comes with 2 massive expansion packs, Tribunal and Bloodmoon, each with their own quests, dungeons, weapons, armor, characters, and treasure to plunder. Playing on PC will allow you access to mods, which can completely change your game. This game barely needs it though, it is a masterfully crafted world with loads to do and locales to get lost in. Hours of enjoyment abound for whoever picks up this gem, can't recommend enough to RPG fans.

review_headline: You asked for it. Well, Japan asked for it. When's our Blanc game again?
review_body:
Hyperdevotion is by far the worst Neptunia game I've played. The only way I can properly express my displeasure is with a list.

The Leading Ladies: Noire is the main focus this time, which was immediately a red flag since Noire is third best goddess in most games, but the worst in this because it's Ultradimension Noire, which adds an extra layer of pretentious brat on top of the already bland tsundere (shy girl for the uninformed) character. The other goddesses are far more interesting, with my favorites, Blanc and Neptune, saving every scene they're in. They added a male character, but I didn't even remember him until I glazed over another review. I shouldn't even mention him, considering the plot barely changes without him. No candidates though. Take that as you want, but I see it as a negative.

The Supporting Makers: As is usual for the series, the supporting cast is made up of representatives for large gaming companies, stand-outs this time being Final Fantasy and Street Fighter characters. What also stands out is the abhorrent amount of sexual harassment Noire endures. More than half the introduction cut scenes for the characters are her being groped, pinned down, or otherwise molested. The only time I liked this was when she was drugged and about to be turned into a mecha, but that scene would have worked better with her clothes on. And those introductory cut scenes? Those are the only characterization you get for them. Some have cut scenes when you fight them before recruitment, but it's little more than showing the characters visual novel picture. They are all unique in combat, but they needed more character moments to flesh them out.

The Gameplay: Weak characters aside, it can work if the gameplay is fun, right? Yes, it can and for a while it did. Then I started noticing how broken the game is. You have a limited height you can fall without taking damage. Enemies do not. You cannot attack over a ledge unless you use magic. Enemies can. You only stay in HDD for 3 rounds. The enemies stay that way all match. You can only use finishers when you have built up your lily gauge. Enemies spam them every turn without any action that would allude to them even having a lily gauge. With how often you fight future or past party members, it's almost impossible not to notice how unfair the game is, letting enemies break rules that you have to follow. It kills the strategy and forced me at one point to continually quit and select make easier until the finishers did no damage to me, but that I'm saving for the spoiler story section. I enjoyed the gameplay otherwise, with one specific section near the end making you carefully choose what units to use, how and when. Too bad the section before it ruined the experience for it.

The Story of kinda Spoilers: It's Neptunia one. Arfoire tricks Noire out of her power, she has to go around building a party and they fight Airfore at the end. It isn't that simple when annalyzing plot points, but if you look at it as a whole, it's basically a less in-depth version of the original Neptunia plot with Noire as the lead.

Now the Major Spoilers to do With Gameplay: Remember how I said the game was unfair? How enemies could just spam finishers? Well here's the kicker. The game sets you up to either need to grind or exploit the make easier function. Let me explain. In chapter 5ish, Blanc, Vert and Neptune go off to defend their home countries. As you'd expect, things go bad. Vert is mind controlled, Blanc is a zombie and Neptune is patriotic... Yes, it really is as silly as it sounds, but this was a fun mixing up of the gameplay to make things interesting, even though it is when I started to notice how unfair the game was, since Vert is usually useless, but is a god when she can ignore the rules. Then the next chapter is when this game last it's second star. Everyone turns on Noire for basically no reason, so the three remaining goddesses have to saveher. The problem, aside from the AI breaking the rules? All three goddesses went the whole last chapter without getting ANY EXP! This was the point where I lost it, because you don't get to back out and recover your party to grind. You either had to grind levels with only three characters or exploit the restart screen to make the game easier. This was some grade F level game design that I'm surprised more people didn't get angry about. This was the last straw and I just dropped the difficulty to clown shoes until I was able to beat every other party member with only three characters. It's a shame, because right after that is a great segment where you have to carefully divide up your party into four groups, being careful not to leave one group weak on magic, movement or melee. It was an inspired set of levels ruined by the fact I was still pissed about the horrible game design one chapter earlier. The last boss was also OP and I did the same thing because I just wanted to be done.

In Short: Don't bother. Get Fire Emblem: Awakening if you like RTS and get any other Neptunia game unless you love Noire and don't mind her being constantly molested. I was close to giving this a two star, since it does have a really good section near the end, but poor story, little characterization and unfair gameplay makes this a game I would rather just forget. I would give it a 3 out of ten, but that isn't an option.

review_headline: It is like a PS Vita without screen... and without compatibility with a lot of Vita games...

This device was intended to play your console games in any tv of you house (streaming over your local network from the PS4 to the PSTV) without carrying your PS4 around your home, which is nice, but the problem is that the stream quality is not good.
The another issue is that the PSTV is compatible with selected PSVita and PSone Classic games, but the catalog is small compared with all the PSVita and PSone games that exist.
So, you basically have a downgraded version of a PSVita with a poor streaming connection to your PS4. Also, if you want to use it to watch your favorite TV Series and Movies from Netflix, don't buy this because is not compatible.

review_headline: Strap on Your Helmet! Madden is Back!
review_body:
[[ASIN:B00W435BU0 Madden NFL 16 - PlayStation 4]]
Remember when Madden used to be fun, and you couldn't wait to play your friends, well that game has returned, and returned well. The Madden 16 Dev Team has done an outstanding job capturing the little things as well as the big things, and that what's made this game one of the best in Madden history.
Does that mean this game is perfect? NO! What it does mean though?... It's awesome!

The all new passing mechanics, and WR/DB interactions have elevated this series to the next level. There needs to be some tuning, but the overall feel of these new additions to game play, have made the game come alive like never before.

I'm sure by now you've heard the new mode called, Draft Champions. Let me tell you this game mode is straight fire, and worth the time to play. I know Madden Ultimate Team can be expensive, and once you fall behind those guys who have 99 everything it can be very challenging to compete, well all that is solved in Draft Champions. One it's free to play, and you draft your team through a 15 round drafting system, that allows you to play with current stars, and Legends all in one. You can compete vs the cpu, or online head to head verse others like yourself. With this mode you can't just play it once, and it will become addicting very quickly.

Connected Franchise has taken some steps in the right direction, and you can already see the vision for this mode for many years to come. CFM has had some changes in scouting, and the way you run your draft board in the offseason, and those changes are great little additions to the game.
CFM is on the rise, and I'm really looking forward to what is ahead for this mode.

There are some bugs, that needs addressing, but all in all this game has captured the vision of Ghost of Madden past, and is looking very, very bright for the future.

*Tip* Stay off the triangle button when playing Defense. If you wantto get beat deep every time go for the pick every throw, and you will look like a chump, play smart football, and you will win your share of games!

The extra range of motion you get out of the added height on the joysticks let me bump up my look sensitivity by 1 without any setbacks, which in a shooter is extremely helpful.

product_title: NES30 PRO Game Controller - PC Mac Linux
review_body: My first reaction was that is was much smaller and thinner than I imagined but this is good because it is very portable.  I have two of the regular NES30 gamepads and they have served me well for over a year.  The only negative is that I couldn't play Android games that require an analog stick (there are many) and there was not enough buttons for Playstation emulated games.  The Pro is just as well made and even seems to handle Bluetooth connections better while adding analog controls and more buttons.  The layout of the controller is just like a Playstation controller complete with L1, L2, R1, R2 and the sticks double as clickable buttons as well.  Having the analog sticks makes compatibility with games go way up.  The sticks are very accurate for their small size.  I was playing Ape Escape with it like a pro as well as some first person shooters.  The buttons feel solid and have a nice click to them and the analog sticks even have little rubber inserts in the tops of them to give a better grip.  The d-pad is also great and feels like an original NES controller.  (Finding any gamepad in this day and age that has a good d-pad is a feat.)  This thing looks amazing and has a cool LED light effect around the edge.  The lights change color and flashing pattern depending on the state of the controller.  It may not be as comfortable to hold as a full size Playstation controller, especially for long gaming sessions. If you want something portable that is high quality and also looks great, then this is what you want.  Pros:  great retro look with a modern twist, solid build, light weight, good dpad and analog sticks, long lasting battery, easy to charge using phone charger, can connect to nearly anything.  Cons:  Small size and close button placement could cause issues with larger hands.

review_headline: Looking for a cheap game where you get to shoot and blow everything up but doesn't require any commitment? This is it.
review_body: This game is basically a no frills, "I just want to shoot and blow stuff up" game. The thin story line is basically there to justify and hang the shooting and explosions on, and doesn't require any commitment (ex: The enemy is called The Target.). You'll almost never run out of bullets, which would defeat the point of the game. My biggest complaint I have for this game, however, is the poor sight system. It's responsiveness is rather sluggish and it can make it difficult to aim at what you want to shoot. However, since you'll almost never run out of bullets, it's not too much of a problem since you just shoot everything in front of you, and you get used to it anyway. Overall, I thought it was a fun game that succeeded at what it was intended for despite having a few flaws, namely the sight system. If you answered yes to the title question, I recommend buying this game.

review_headline: This is the perfect gift! Turned me into a penny pinching uncle that could do no wrong on the holidays.
review_body:
I got this as a Christmas present for my nephews years ago and it was probably one of the most wonderful gifts I have given them. This edition of Skylanders was cheap, since this game series comes up with new backwards compatible versions of the game every year or so and this is the first version. To a couple of nephews around 5 years old, it was the best thing EVER. Now they have all the skylander stuff : t-shirts, stuffed animals, lunchboxes, backpacks, posters and, of course, the latest and greatest editions of the game and characters every holiday since then.

To explain the craze for Skylanders is kind of difficult. If you are someone who just glaces at the price tag and the cost of each new character not featured in the starter pack it can be a little daunting unless you look more into it. A fully up to date edition of a Skylanders starter pack can be found in the store up to $70 + each and the regular figures that go with can be over $10 each, so it can make most people balk at the price tag at first, but the secret is that if you manage to stay a generation or two behind the prices not only drop considerably but you will still have enough content through the backwards compatible figures to keep kids entertained throughout many a birthday. The starter pack I bought only cost my about $20 because its an older edition, the starter pack comes with three characters that 2 players can play at the same time ( great if you have two bored kids in the house), all three of those characters take time to level up so every birthday or so they are about bored enough to be thrilled to get a new one on the next gift giving holiday.

There are a ridiculous amount of characters so I have been spending about $10 bucks per birthday with very little stress involved because apparently an uncle can do no wrong by just sending in the next Skylander character in the set. It's like collecting cards, playing GIJoes, and playing Pokemon all at once for them, until they grow out of it a new Skylander is always the perfect gift. Made shopping pretty consistent on the holidays.hey grow out of it a new Skylander is always the perfect gift. Made shopping pretty consistent on the holidays.

review_headline: I Dishonored This Game By Not Playing It Sooner!
review_body:
Bad jokes aside, Dishonored is one out of the few video games I’ve played that harmonizes stealth with action perfectly. This game allows players to choose how to tackle each level without being linear. Want to be an assassin and silently take down enemies from the shadows? Or how about run in-guns blazing-with a small rat army? There’s always the option to mix it up and do both!
Each level is well thought out and the combat is highly addictive. I also enjoyed the leveling up system with power/skills; There's teleporting (Which is extremely handy), seeing through objects, and slowing down time to name a few. Did I mention that you can summon a small rat army?
Every character felt unique, plus the voice acting was phenomenal. The story is immersive and I was often asked to make hard decisions pertaining to missions. Little did I know that my choices would ultimately affect the stories final confrontation. Come the last cut scenes, I was emotionally touched, but I won’t spoil anything. For story goers, there is plenty of replay ability to be had here. If that’s not enough, then there’s always the fact that there’s more than one difficulty to play on.
Altogether, Dishonored was a blast and I’m glad I picked it up on a whim despite my skepticism. The graphical improvements are a nice touch and prove welcoming on the PS4. From what I can tell it looks a little cleaner than the PS3 version. Not to mention it comes with all the original dlc.

review_headline: Two Years On and The Charger & Original Batteries Are Still Going!
review_body:
This was the first third party hardware I purchased for my Xbox One. I am a Day One owner of the console and picked up this charger about two days later. I had a little trouble getting the battery and cover properly seated, but not to the level of frustration. I am not crazy about the design of the charger itself. The battery must connect with the charging element exactly and if one does not CAREFULLY place the controller into the "saddle," no charging will occur, even though all appears properly seated. Yes, there is a light indicating that the controller is in place as well as a (very) small red/green light which crudely indicates the charge level of the battery. One would think all is well if the indicator is lit. However, the light does not stay on. Sometimes, the controller would be fully charged even though the indicator was not lit. Other times, there would be no charge. I found the best solution was to NOT sit the charger flat on a table or shelf. When I did this, the battery and charging contact would sometimes separate. Instead, I place the charger on a 45 degree angle, so that gravity aids in pushing the controller against the charging contact.

The batteries I began using in November 2013 are STILL viable. I play Destiny 3-4 hours daily and the batteries show no sign of weakening. I give the charger 4 stars in spite of the issues I have had with it. I blame Microsoft for what appears to me to be a lineup of truly odd shaped chargers, the Nyko among the earliest of them. The Xbox 360 had rechargeable batteries that were easily removed from the controllers and snapped into a small, esthetically pleasing charging station. The Xbox One has required the entire controller to be involved in the charging process. What was Microsoft thinking? In the sense of design, it's a step backwards.

I'm at a loos for words for the quality of this game. As a frequent player of eroge/visual novels, I was not sure how this game would play since I'm used to reading dialogue and changing character expressions. After seeing that this is fully animated with subtitles, I gained more interest since it's completely new to me. This is a great take on doing visual novels differently. The playback quality is smooth, moments are unexpected depending on your choices, character development is just as good as the anime itself, and the adult scenes don't hold back anything. This was a great buy and I'd definitely recommend.

review_headline: Awesome end to a great franchise
review_body: Great addition (and end) to the Batman franchise. I hate to see this series come to an end (hopefully another developer will take the reins). But this was a great game with great fighting mechanics. The addition of the batmobile is great. I loved being able to drive around Gotham. Sometimes I would lose control when driving too fast and taking corners, but I'll chalk that up to my poor driving skills. Excellent voice acting, incredible visuals and cool story. Highly recommended.

product_title: yueton 5 Pairs Replacement Cat Pad Style Silicone Analog Controller Joystick Thumb Stick Grip Cap Cover for Sony PlayStation 4 Controller
review_headline: First thing I have to say, they are incredible.
review_body: Don't hesitate on buying these. I wore mine out a week ago playing God of War 3 and I was originally planning on sending them to Sony for a replacement. The rubbers wear out on some Playstation 4 controllers that are first generation.  Long story short, delivery was quick, and easy to install. My original were split in the center which created a "lift" on the rubber in the center that could be felt. I was skeptical at first, but after they arrive they fit perfectly. I removed the split rubbers from the old controller by hand. They come right off with no resistance or left over residue. Slide these sideways and they wrap around perfectly. They are slightly loose, but not overly and when playing they stay still. This was probably made that way so you could angle them in from any direction and then straighten them once on. They look nice and make the controller stand out. You could possibly add these on a controller that are not worn out like mine for extra grip.  Pros: solid grip, they look nice once on, adding a little flare and originality to your controller. (i'll upload an image) Cons: The only con I can find by being picky would be they can be ripped while putting them on the controller. This can be avoided by simply going slow and angle them sideways when installing. After in "locks" in one side, you can slide the rest on and pat it on the top so it slides under it.
My grandson will love it! :-)

product_title: Settlers IV Gold Edition Including The Mission CD, The Trojans and The Elixir of Power Expansion
review_body:
The Good

Multi-tiered economy is awesome - the best of any game. Very deep with lots of various resources to harvest, lots of things to make and steps. For example, a grain farm and a grain mill to make flour, water and flour for the bakery, which makes bread for the coal miners. Coal and iron ore to the smelter. Iron bars and coal to the weapons maker. Weapons to the barracks where you can create units. Meat for the iron miners. Fish for the gold miners. There are also sulfur and stone miners. Lumberyards, stone cutters (from stone on the map rather than mines). Harbors, heavy weapons, etc, etc, etc.
Perfect controls on the various buildings.
Very deep - magic, thieves, etc, in addition to various levels of combat units.
Land must be cleared, things must be built. (Rather than just popping up like Stronghold.)
Various civilian units must have tools to do their job - made at the tool works. It all is awesomely integrated.

The Bad

The absolute worst is that the AI goes insane on unit creation. I was trucking along, doing nicely and built two groups of combat units with 45 each - what I thought was a good army - bigger than most other games. When I went to attack, they were obliterated by hundreds. I built hundreds on a retry, with 5 large towers, goaded him into attacking me and it still wasn't enough. It was ridiculous and ruined this game. This was on the Easy setting. On Easy, it should continue with its tower building, but only have a handful of units at each tower, not hundreds overall. There is no way to control this setting.
No walls nor gates and the AI attacks everywhere.
The mines seem to stop producing, but there was no reason why.
The priest spell to “replenish resources” didn't seem to to anything.
The Fog of War is way overdone - most of the time I couldn't see a thing and I really hate that.
Defenses are fairly weak.
Civilian buildings and civilians are not attacked. You can only attack defensive emplacements and soldiers. This is just weird. Well, some civilians can be attacked, like your geologists (used to find ore) and pioneers (used to push back the territory boundaries). Buildings explode when territory is claimed, and that, too, is just weird.
My son loves this set!

review_headline: Replacement for a TV without the old RCA option

Then we realized we messed up the two Red connectors (apparently it DOES matter) and everything works wonderfully.  Sharp picture (but don't expect ultra high def, silly).  Clear audio. The games were remastered rather well but after finally giving these games a try after owning this collection for more than a few years I have to say that it's slightly disappointing. Some of the games in this collection freeze up while your playing particularly Sly 2. If not for that I would have given this collection 4 stars. I love Sly Cooper but after the first game the series became a bit of a drag with the games hitting the 14+ hour mark of gameplay. Completely unnecessary for a platformer. The original game clocked in around 7 hours which was about perfect and didn't drag you down with inane storylines and constant repetitive tasks. There's a lot of poor design decisions in the later games as well. Example: The devs will make it a chore for you to get your next mission which involves jumping up somewhere that isn't immediately obvious and when you finally make it to the designated spot you only receive a mission briefing. All that work just for a mission briefing. Anyway like I mentioned I like the Sly games a lot but I'll always prefer the first game in the series for its more simplistic and straightforward formula.

There is also an option to enhance the graphics even further with an extra disk to add more texture, but it isn't fully necessary. The graphics are better even without it. review_headline: My kids didn't really like this game
review_body:
My kids didn't really like this game.
It's not physical enough. Hey quickly got bored and didn't want to play anymore. They didn't like that it was just shooting or that they basically only used their hands. They like more of the running and jumping games.

review_headline: AC is close to my heart, but below my expectations.
review_body: I have been an Assassin's Creed fan from the very beginning when I first bought my PS3. It has gone a very long way as you can agree. Being that this is for a next-gen console the graphics are truly stunning and beautiful. France is alive full of detailed buildings and surroundings that truly make you appreciate every climb and synchronization. However, when it comes to the characters, combat system, and glitches, there are many flaws. First, at some points in the game the characters look real and detailed but most often the characters are a little cartoonish and leave out what would make them truly look human. Secondly, what I found to be most disappointing and frustrating is the combat system and stealth. They threw out the easy parry system and chain kills which I thought were pretty badass in AC3 and Revelations. Which brings up the point that many AC games in the past would have new skills or upgrades that had us on the edge of our seat in anticipation. But when it came to a sequel they would throw out what we loved and try to come up with a new, better weapon or skill which failed to impress. The AI in the game are much more advanced, meaning they are quicker, give and cause more damage, and can spot you almost everytime you try to be stealthy. I agree it was easier before but now things have gotten really frustrating. When you try to flee because of the large amounts of enemies (which will happen) it takes more effort to become anonymous and somehow they succeed in shooting from a far distance even while you are moving. Also, the parry system is not as very responsive so often times you will be stabbed. Overall, the game has its hits and misses and I definitely miss the old combat and AI system and the excitement I once had. The one definite hit it has is its graphics, which was barely enough for me to truly enjoy the game.

product_title: DBPOWER® USB Cooling Fan Cooler External Turbo Temperature Controller for Playstation PS4
review_body:
I feel like this item is getting no love. The fan work how it should be. It keeps my Ps4 cooled.

Pro's : It keeps the ps4 cooled. It does what it says it does.

Con's : It's not as loud as people are saying. For a comparison if you are playing your ps4 and it's starting to get out it makes like a loud Fan noise just the ps4 alone. If you connect the cooler yes it makes a little noise but it's lower then when u didn't have a cooler on it. The ps4 noise alone is 10 times louder with out the cooling fan.

2nd con : If you are moving the wires back there like the a/c cord or the hdmi, it might slide out off place but if you leave the weird alone it will stay where it needs to be.

review_body: I added this to my collection as it was my original Pokemon.  The figure is nicely detailed, and fits well among my Amiibo collection.

SO! I have had this game brand new from GameStop for the PS3
I bought it digitally on Amazon.com
I purchased a physical copy due to the Amazon downloader not functioning properly (just put in a new SSD and reformatted my computer)
That physical copy will be returned, and I may or may not purchase another one.

Be careful with merchants on Amazon:
I am not happy with the used copy I received from a merchant, as the booklet was soaked. The game had been resealed with a bunch of moisture inside the case. The code was "unused," but should have actually been labelled as "useless" instead, due to ink running and pages sticking.
